summary: Minsk is the capital and biggest city of Belarus, with a population of around two million. It is located on two rivers and is an important administrative center. The city has a long history, first mentioned in 1067, and has been part of various kingdoms and empires over the centuries. It became the capital of Belarus after the country gained independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. Minsk is also an administrative hub for the Commonwealth of Independent States and the Eurasian Economic Union.
title: Minsk
